org.gearvrf

Class GVRRenderTarget

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.gearvrf.GVRHybridObject
      • org.gearvrf.GVRComponent
        • org.gearvrf.GVRBehavior
          • org.gearvrf.GVRRenderTarget
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    GVRDrawFrameListener
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    GVRShadowMap

    public class GVRRenderTarget
extends GVRBehavior
    A render target is a component which allows the scene to be rendered into a texture from the viewpoint of a particular scene object. GVRRenderTarget can initiate a DrawFrameListener which causes the scene to be rendered into the texture every frame. To initiate rendering you must call @{link #startListening()}. A render target may also have a custom camera to allow control over the projection matrix.
    See Also:
    GVRRenderTexture, GVRShadowMap

    • Constructor Detail

      • GVRRenderTarget

        public GVRRenderTarget(GVRRenderTexture texture,
                       GVRScene scene)
        Constructs a render target component which renders the given scene to a designated texture. The objects in the scene are rendered from the viewpoint of the scene object the GVRRenderTarget is attached to. Nothing is rendered if the render target is not attached to a scene object. You must call @{link #setEnable(true)} to initiate rendering.
        Parameters:
        texture - GVRRenderTexture to render to.
        scene - GVRScene to render.
        See Also:
        GVRComponent.setEnable(boolean)

      • setTexture

        public void setTexture(GVRRenderTexture texture)
        Sets the texture this render target will render to. If no texture is provided, the render target will not render anything.
        Parameters:
        texture - GVRRenderTexture to render to.

      • getTexture

        public GVRRenderTexture getTexture()
        Gets the GVRRenderTexture being rendered to by this render target.
        Returns:
        GVRRenderTexture used by the render target or null if none specified.
        See Also:
        setTexture(GVRRenderTexture)

      • onDrawFrame

        public void onDrawFrame(float frameTime)
        Description copied from class: GVRBehavior
        Called each frame before rendering the scene. It is not called if this behavior is not attached to a GVRSceneObject.
        Specified by:
        onDrawFrame in interface GVRDrawFrameListener
        Overrides:
        onDrawFrame in class GVRBehavior
        Parameters:
        frameTime - Seconds since the previous frame - see GVRContext.getFrameTime()
